intro: Mohria diptera, commonly known as the common mohria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its daisy-like inflorescence, consisting of ray florets and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are usually alternate, lance-shaped, and have a rough texture. Mohria diptera is known for its ecological importance as a food source for various pollinators.
